info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 9:28PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN HARRISON...NORTHERN JEFFERSON...SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...SOUTHEASTERN CARROLL... SOUTHWESTERN BEAVER...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...WESTERN ALLEGHENY AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 1030 PM EDT... At 927 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Ellwood City to near Minerva. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Weirton, Steubenville, East Liverpool, Wellsville, Toronto, Calcutta, Wintersville, Ohioville, Midland, Chester, Industry, New Cumberland, Shippingport, Salineville, Newell, Bergholz, Amsterdam, Richmond, Irondale, and New Manchester. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for east central Ohio...western and southwestern Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia.
